name: Unpivot Avaya CM Agent List Report
tagline: Automatically transpose the exported CSV from Avaya CM's Agent Report
body:
# The problem
The default agent skill assignment report (snapshot) from Avaya CM / GEDI is provided in an awkward format, this is an F# script that transforms the exported CSV files to a more workable tabular format.



# Contents
* License
* Requirements
* Getting the data (CSV Export from CM / GEDI)
* Running the script - Running the Binaries
* Running the script - Installing the Binaries
* Running the script - Execution in F# Interactive Window (Visual Studio)
* Running the script - Compiling from source and  (Visual Studio)
* Trademarks Notice



# License
MIT 2.0 License (use the code however you wish, including for commercial purposes). Attribution welcome but not required.

The code only interacts with the CSV files generated by the Avaya CM reporting engine after they are saved to the user's disk drive and do not in anyway interface with Avaya proprietary technology, nor require Avaya system credentials. The script is provided as is and the author is not liable for anything resulting from its use.



# Requirements
* Avaya Site Administrator installed on your system
* Credentials for logging into GEDI and the ability to run and export the 'agent list' report
* Alternatively, access to a CSV file representation of the agent list report exported by someone with the above privileges following the steps outlined in 'Getting the data'
* OPTIONAL: Visual Studio 2013 Community Edition (FREE) or higher if you want to build from source of run the script in an Interactive Window



# Getting the data (CSV Export from CM / GEDI)
We'll export a CSV representation of the Agent List report from Avaya Site Administrator:

* Launch Avaya Site Administrator
* Login to GEDI
* Run the agent list snapshot report by typing in 'li ag' in the report execution command box
* Once the report has finished loading, click on _File_ > _Export_
* In the dialog box, select a memorable name and location for the exported report. Make sure you are saving as .csv.
* Ensure the 'Export column titles on first row?' check box is checked and click _OK_
* You should now have a CSV file with an undesirable structure, next run the script on the file.



# Running the script - Running the Binaries
